events.name: Augustus establishes the Empire
events.description: Augustus establishes the Roman Empire and becomes its first emperor.

events.name: Great Fire of Rome
events.description: The Great Fire of Rome occurs during the rule of Emperor Nero.

events.name: Building of the Colosseum
events.description: Construction of the Colosseum begins under Emperor Vespasian and is completed under his son Titus.

events.name: Crisis of the Third Century
events.description: A period of military, political, and economic crisis that nearly caused the collapse of the Empire.

events.name: Building of the Baths of Caracalla
events.description: The Baths of Caracalla are built, one of the largest public baths in Rome.

events.name: Building of the Aurelian Walls
events.description: Construction of the Aurelian Walls to protect Rome from external threats.

events.name: Reforms of Diocletian
events.description: Emperor Diocletian introduces significant administrative and military reforms.

events.name: Battle of Milvian Bridge
events.description: Constantine wins the Battle of Milvian Bridge, leading to his conversion to Christianity.

events.name: Founding of Constantinople
events.description: Constantine founds Constantinople, which becomes the new capital of the Roman Empire.

events.name: Definitive separation of Western and Eastern Roman Empire
events.description: The Roman Empire is definitively split into Western and Eastern halves.

events.name: Sack of Rome by the Goths
events.description: The Goths of Alaric sack Rome.

events.name: Sack of Rome by the Vandals
events.description: The Vandals of Gaiseric sack Rome.

events.name: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
events.description: The fall of the Western Roman Empire and deposition of the final emperor Romulus Augustulus.

events.name: Gothic War
events.description: The Goths cut off the aqueducts in the siege of Rome, traditionally regarded as the beginning of the Middle Ages in Italy.

events.name: Pantheon converted to Christian church
events.description: Emperor Phocas donates the Pantheon to Pope Boniface IV, converting it into a Christian church; Column of Phocas is erected.

events.name: Curia Julia transformed
events.description: The Curia Julia is transformed into the basilica of Sant'Adriano al Foro.

events.name: Constans II visits Rome
events.description: Constans II visits Rome, stripping buildings of their ornaments and bronze to be carried back to Constantinople.

events.name: Lombard conquest of the Exarchate of Ravenna
events.description: The Lombard conquest of the Exarchate of Ravenna cuts off the Duchy of Rome from the empire.

events.name: Establishment of the Papal States
events.description: Alliance with the Franks; Pepin the Younger invades Italy and establishes the Papal States.
